abstract.text: A 3D surface made of polygons.

inlineContent.text: A mesh surface can be convex or concave, and can have zero volume (for example, a flat shape such as a square)
but shouldn’t contain holes or exposed back-faces.
The result of CSG operations on meshes that have holes or exposed back-faces is undefined.

topicSections.title: Creating Meshes from Vertices, Points or LineSegments

abstract.text: Euclid is a library for creating and manipulating 3D geometry using techniques such as extruding or “lathing” 2D paths to create solid 3D shapes, and CSG (Constructive Solid Geometry) to combine or subtract those shapes from one another.
A 3D surface made of polygons.
Alignment mode to use when extruding along a path.
Callback used to cancel a long-running operation.
The face generation policy for Euclid to use when creating a mesh.
Material used by the mesh polygons.
See
for details.
A closure that maps a SceneKit material to a Euclid material.
The texture wrapping mode to use when generating a mesh.
The bounds of the mesh.
Clip mesh to the specified plane and optionally fill sheared faces with specified material.
Creates a conical mesh.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the specified point is inside the mesh.
Computes the convex hull of a set of polygons.
Computes the convex hull of one or more meshes.
Computes the convex hull of a set of paths.
Computes the convex hull of a set of path points.
Computes the convex hull of a set of points.
Computes the convex hull of a set of vertices.
Computes the convex hull of a set of line segments.
Creates an axis-aligned cuboidal mesh.
Creates an axis-aligned cubical mesh.
Creates a cylindrical mesh.
Merges any coplanar polygons that share one or more edges.
Merges coplanar polygons that share one or more edges, provided the result will be convex.
Efficiently gets the difference between multiple meshes.
Computes a set of edges where the mesh intersects a plane.
An empty mesh.
Creates a mesh by extruding one path along another path.
Creates a mesh by extruding a path along its face normal.
Efficiently extrudes an array of paths along their respective face normals, avoiding duplicate work.
Creates a mesh by filling a path to form one or more polygons.
Efficiently fills an array of paths, avoiding unecessary work if there are duplicates.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the mesh includes texture coordinates.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the mesh includes vertex colors.
Creates a new mesh from an array of polygons.
Creates a mesh from a SceneKit node, with optional material mapping.
Creates a mesh from a SceneKit geometry, with the material you provide.
Creates a mesh from a SceneKit geometry, with optional material mapping.
Creates a composite mesh from an array of submeshes.
Loads a mesh from a file using any format supported by SceneKit,  with optional material mapping.
Returns a new mesh representing the volume shared by both the mesh
parameter and the receiver. If these do not intersect, an empty mesh will be returned.
Efficiently computes the intersection of multiple meshes.
Flips the face direction and vertex normals of all polygons within the mesh.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the mesh is watertight, meaning that every edge is
attached to two polygons (or a multiple of two).
Creates a rotationally symmetrical mesh by turning the specified path around the Y axis.
Creates a mesh by connecting a series of 3D paths representing the cross sections.
Removes hairline cracks by inserting additional vertices without altering the shape.
All materials used by the mesh.
The array may contain
if some or all of the mesh uses the default material.
Merges the polygons from two meshes.
Creates a new mesh that is the combination of the polygons from all the specified meshes.
The polygons that make up the mesh.
The polygons in the mesh, grouped by material.
Replaces an existing material with the specified new one.
Returns a rotated copy of the value.
Returns a scaled copy of the value.
Returns a scaled copy of the value.
Smooth vertex normals for corners with angles greater than the specified threshold.
Creates a spherical mesh.
Split the mesh along a plane.
Returns a new mesh that retains the shape of the receiver, but with
the intersecting area colored using material from the parameter.
Efficiently performs a stencil with multiple meshes.
Return ASCII STL string data for the mesh.
Efficiently strokes a collection of line segments (useful for drawing wireframes).
Creates a mesh by stroking a path with the line width, detail, and material you provide.
Efficiently strokes an array of paths, avoiding duplicate work.
The distinct (disconnected) submeshes that make up the mesh.
Returns a new mesh created by subtracting the volume of the
mesh parameter from the receiver.
Splits all polygons in the mesh that are concave or have more than the specified number of
sides into two or more convex polygons.
Creates an extruded text model from a string.
Creates an extruded text model from an attributed string
Returns a transformed copy of the mesh.
Returns a translated copy of the value.
Splits all polygons in the mesh into triangles.
Returns a new mesh representing the combined volume of the
mesh parameter and the receiver, with inner faces removed.
Efficiently forms a union from multiple meshes.
The unique polygon edges in the mesh.
The direction of each edge is normalized relative to the origin to simplify edge-equality comparisons.
Returns a new mesh reprenting only the volume exclusively occupied by
one shape or the other, but not both.
Efficiently XORs multiple meshes.
